sentences.en: a plant normally only found in a Mediterranean climate
sentences.cn: 通常只在地中海气候下才有的一种植物

sentences.en: Britain bakes in a Mediterranean heatwave.
sentences.cn: 地中海的热浪炙烤着英国。

sentences.en: Chef Idris Caldora offers an inspired menu that captures the spirit of the Mediterranean.
sentences.cn: 厨师伊德里斯·卡尔多拉开出一份富有地中海特色的菜单，让人眼前一亮。

sentences.en: Gibraltar is the key to the Mediterranean.
sentences.cn: 直布罗陀是地中海的要冲.

sentences.en: Many aqueducts from ancient Roman times still stand today near the Mediterranean Sea.
sentences.cn: 许多古罗马时代的引水渠至今还保留在地中海附近.

sentences.en: Mediterranean oat held to be progenitor of modern cultivated oat.
sentences.cn: 地中海地区燕麦,被认为是现代栽种燕麦的祖先.

sentences.en: My old friend, Harrison, had lived in the Mediterranean for many years before he returned to England.
sentences.cn: 我的老朋友哈里森在地中海地区居住多年后回到英国.

sentences.en: The houses are Mediterranean in character.
sentences.cn: 这些房子都属地中海风格.

sentences.en: The Mediterranean Sea bathes the shore of Italy.
sentences.cn: 地中海环抱着意大利的海岸.

sentences.en: The Mediterranean Sea boiled with the storm.
sentences.cn: 暴风雨中地中海波涛汹涌.

sentences.en: The Nile discharges itself into the Mediterranean.
The Nile flows from Lake Victoria in East Africa north to the Mediterranean Sea.
sentences.cn: 尼罗河由东非的维多利亚湖向北流至地中海。

sentences.en: The Roman fleet after it had been revictualled and repaired stood right across the Mediterranean.
sentences.cn: 经过再补给及修理后,罗马舰队横拦着地中海

sentences.en: The Straits of Gibraltar are the strategic passage between the Mediterranean and the Atlantic.
sentences.cn: 直布罗陀海峡是地中海通向大西洋的咽喉.

sentences.en: The words "Cote d'Azur" conjure up images of sunny days in Mediterranean cafes.
sentences.cn: Coted’Azur（蓝色海岸）这个词让人联想到地中海咖啡馆阳光明媚的日子。

sentences.en: They will go cruising in the Mediterranean.
sentences.cn: 他们将在地中海上巡游.

sentences.en: You have the choice of night fishing in the Mediterranean, or windsurfing on a lake in Switzerland.
sentences.cn: 你可选择在地中海夜间垂钓，或是在瑞士的湖上玩帆板。

phrases.tran_cn: 地中海饮食；地中海型饮食

trans.tran_cn: 地中海的，地中海地区的，地中海居民的
trans.tran_en: relating to the Mediterranean Sea, or typical of the area of southern Europe around it
